1.title: Van Gogh: The Absolute Painter
1.plot: How did van Gogh, son of Dutch middle class parents, become Vincent the painter? Is the common perception of him as the ultimate tormented artist the whole story? Explore the roots of his life, and the progress of his incredible talent despite many failures both personal and professional.

2.title: Rodin
2.plot: Auguste Rodin followed his intuition and was inspired as well by the relationships with his models. Behind each of his works there was either a scandal or a controversy. He left us "The Thinker" and "The Kiss", two of the most famous sculptures in the world. Here is his story.

3.title: Le Corbusier: Modern, Absolutely Modern
3.plot: Becoming a central figure in Parisian life in the 1920's when in his early 30's, Le Corbusier was a writer, essayist, editor, painter, lecturer, but more than anything else, an architect of the Modern Era. His influence on architecture and design is incalculable.

4.title: Picasso
4.plot: Picasso - You think you know him, but do you really ? Take an in-depth look at his art, his turbulent life, and the lasting impact he made on the art of the 20th Century.

5.title: Paparazzi: Art or Exploitation
5.plot: Federico Fellini coined the term "paparazzi". The curse of celebrities, the bane of existence of the indiscreet, do photographers like Ron Galella contribute to our understanding of the lives of the famous or are they voyeurs? And do they influence and create art? Is there a paparazzi aesthetic?

6.title: Roy Lichtenstein: Behind the Mirror
6.plot: Picasso - You think you know him, but do you really ? Take an in-depth look at his art, his turbulent life, and the lasting impact he made on the art of the 20th Century.

7.title: Pompidou
7.plot: Take a time trip to France in the 1960's-- student revolts. Pop Art!-- and meet Georges Pompidou, a bank director who became PM of France. His vision of modernizing France pushed the avant garde design of the Paris art and cultural center which is now home to the modern arts of France.

8.title: Philippe Parreno
8.plot: Phillippe Parreno has radically redefined the exhibition experience. Rather than as a collection of individual works, Parreno sees an exhibit as a coherent whole and works in many different media including film, text, sculpture and drawing.

9.title: Soulages: The Radiance of Black
9.plot: Pierre Soulages, the painter of the anti-image, who uses a palette of black, is the subject of this fascinating documentary. The preeminent painter of contemporary France, his paintings are stark and plain and painted with unconventional materials.

10.title: Monumenta: The Imaginary City of the Kabukovs
10.plot: "Monumenta" is an ephemeral art construction happening yearly since 2007, with art filling the vast space of the Grand Palais in Paris in a unique moment. This year the exhibit is the imaginary, complex world of two Russian artists, Ilya and Emilia Kabakov.

imdb.plot outline: How did van Gogh, son of Dutch middle class parents, become Vincent the painter? Is the common perception of him as the ultimate tormented artist the whole story? Explore the roots of his life, and the progress of his incredible talent despite many failures both personal and professional.
imdb.title: Behind the Artist
plot: Take a deeper look at the art world through interviews with artists, art historians and curators as they look at unique artists and venues.

How did van Gogh, son of Dutch middle class parents, become Vincent the painter? Is the common perception of him as the ultimate tormented artist the whole story? Explore the roots of his life, and the progress of his incredible talent despite many failures both personal and professional.
